intro: Baraultia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar baraulia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish or greenish coloration. Baraultia madagascariensis is adapted to the dry and arid conditions of its native habitat, showing resilience to drought.
